column1: Gevrai or Georai is a tehsil in the Beed district of Maharashtra
Gevrai is located at 19.16°N 75.45°E﻿ / 19.16; 75.45 and has an average elevation of 465 metres (1528 feet).
It lies on National Highway 211 which connects Solapur – Osmanabad – Beed – Aurangabad – Dhule in Maharashtra
column2: and also National Highway 222 connecting Vishakhapatnam – Kalyan.

column1: As of the 2011 census of India
column3: 562. With males constituting 52% of the population and females 48%. Gevrai has an average literacy rate of 67%
column4: which is higher than the national average of 59.5%: male literacy is 76%
column5: while female literacy is at 58%. In Gevrai
column6: 14% of the population is under 6 years of age.

column1: R. B. Attal College of Arts

column2: the political scene in Gevrai had been dominated by Shivajirao Pandit
column5: Amarsingh Pandit. The current MLA for the Gevrai Vidhan Sabha constituency is BJP's Adv. Laxman Pawar who belongs to the Patil family (historically
column6: the traditional heads of Gevrai). He won the 2014 Vidhan Sabha election by defeating NCP's Badamrao Pandit in a landslide of 60001 votes - the highest win margin in the Marathwada region. Amarsingh Pandit currently represents Gevrai as an MLC. In the recent Municipal elections
column7: BJP won 18 of the 19 seats and also the President of Municipality position
column8: further consolidating the position of MLA Laxman Pawar in the town.
